result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance P Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Terrance P Simmons was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Terrance P Simmons is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Terrance P Simmons was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:46am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner ; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Atty Lennon.
(Argued SAR)

State requests any outstanding supervision fees to be converted to CV judgment, and requests defendant be sentenced to 90 days MCJ w/74 days credit.
Atty Lennon requests 74 days be ordered, and makes argument on sentence.

COURT ORDERS: 90 days MCJ w/credit for 74 days of time served, with understanding that the sentence is time served w/good time
COURT also orders any outstanding fees converted to CV judgment.

Adj: 11:52am
of September 29, 2015 Testimony of Melissa Wimmer
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 22, 2016 at 11:15 am.
to Defense Motion to Dimiss Dometic Abuse Ehancer-State's

Clerk Cheree
Cases 15CF548 and 15CM1893 called: 3:31pm
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan

State moves to D&RI entire file of 15CM1893>>COURT Grants.

15CF548>>
(Motion to Dismiss Repeater Enhancer and to Dismiss Domestic Abuse Enhancer filed by defense)
COURT notes only Ct. 4 is applicable - State moves to DISMISS Repeater allegation on Ct. 4 - COURT grants.

COURT then notes only issue remaining is Motion to Dismiss D.A. enhancer - COURT has reviewed all submissions on this issue; Argument by Attorney Jackan and by State.
COURT makes rulings - COURT grants Motion to Dismiss D.A. enhancer.
COURT recesses for parties to discuss sentence; BOTR: 3:52pm - Parties have reached agreed upon sentence recommendation and state for COURT

15CF548>>
COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 4 (DC)>>  Sentence W/held; 1 year Probation
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; DNA sample and surcharge.

>>If revoked defendant has one day credit for time served.

Adj: 3:54pm
AMENDED.  $1000.00 signature bond with first $200.00 in cash.
AMENDED. $1000.00 signature bond with first $200.00 in cash.

State's Supplemental Response to Defense Motion to Dismiss Domestic Abuse Enhancer
-stj
and Certificate of Appearance (subpoena served on D.W. for M.R.W. 9/21/15)
Jurors Selection and Peremptory Challenges (List of sworn jurors)
for Adjournment by State dated 9/28/15; Denied by Judge Grau dated 9/28/15

Clerk Cheree
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Kat Jackan.
Bailiffs Dick Weiks and Theresa Miles

9:08am -- Jury enters; Juror #6 (R.L.M.) has been excused and replaced by Juror #21 (R.G.R.)
9:14am -- Bailiff opens court;  Jury panel sworn.
Parties introduce witnesses and COURT conducts voir dire.
Juror #10 (S.R.W.) excused for cause by COURT and replaced by Juror #22 (T.L.M.)
9:25am - Voir dire by State; 9:55am - Voir dire by Attorney Jackan.
10:05am - COURT thanks and excuses jurors behind rail and COURT orders jury list to be struck by counsel.
10:10am - COURT reads list of jurors chosen to hear this case; COURT thanks and excuses other jurors not chosen.
10:14am - Jury sworn; COURT admonishes jury that they may not communicate to anyone regarding this case, and jury cannot engage in any investigation of any type until service in this case is concluded.
10:18am -- Jury and COURT recess; 10:38am -- JURY/COURT reconvene; COURT gives preliminary jury instructions.
10:46am -- Opening statement by State; 10:53am -- Opening statement by Attorney Jackan
10:58am - Testimony begins; M.W. sworn and testifies;
COURT/JURY recess for audio problems - BOTR: 11:17am COURT/JURY reconvene; Exhibit 5 (audio) played; Testimony of M.W. continues.
11:43am - JURY recesses; State requests other acts motion be reviewed by COURT at this time, and State be allowed to question victim - argument by Atty Jackan; COURT makes rulings.
11:50am - JURY reconvenes; Testimony of M.W. continues; COURT advises witness she is still under subpoena for this trial.
11:58am -- Officer Shawn Fritsch (WPD) sworn and testifies - identifies defendant; Exhibits 1-4 published to jury.
12:30pm - JURY/COURT recess. 
1:31pm -- COURT/JURY reconvene; Officer Anthony Reince (WPD) sworn and testifies - identifies defendant.
1:37pm - State rests; JURY recesses -- COURT questions defense re: witnesses; Defense will not call any witnesses including defendant.
COURT questions Atty Jackan and defendant regarding defendant's decision not to testify - COURT finds defendant knowingly and voluntarily makes decision regarding testimony.
Attorney Jackan moves to dismiss - COURT denies motion.
1:45pm -- JURY reconvenes; Attorney Jackan rests; COURT notes that testimony is closed; COURT explains to jury longer recess will be taken now as COURT and counsel meet for jury instructions.
1:47pm - JURY again recesses; COURT discusses exhibits with parties; COURT will meet with counsel in chambers now for jury instruction conference - 1:50pm
2:20pm -- COURT reconvenes; COURT questions counsel re: verdict forms and instructions - both counsel state they are in agreement.
2:22pm -- JURY reconvenes; Closing argument by State; 2:43pm -- Closing argument by Attorney Jackan; 2:48pm -- Rebuttal Closing argument by State.
2:55pm -- COURT instructs jury by reading instructions;  3:18pm -- Bailiffs sworn and jury retires to deliberate case.
COURT notes if any exhibits are requested, parties will reconvene and discuss; COURT recesses 3:20pm
3:59pm -- COURT reconvenes w/defendant and counsel, and advised that jury has reached verdict; 4:00pm - JURY reconvenes and foreperson delivers verdicts to bailiff, and given to COURT.
COURT reads verdicts>>
Ct. 1>>NOT GUILTY
Ct. 2>>NOT GUILTY
Ct. 3>>NOT GUILTY
Ct. 4>>GUILTY
COURT questions foreperson and polls each juror individually - each answer verdicts were and are as read by COURT.
COURT thanks and excuses jury 4:05pm
State moves for entry of judgment as to Ct. 4 - COURT grants and finds defendant guilty.
COURT recesses for parties to discuss sentencing; BOTR: 4:09pm
State and defense are requesting to defer sentencing at this time as an additional charge is going to be filed; COURT grants and parties to schedule sentencing date along with new case w/JA immediately after the conclusion today.
BOND CONTINUES on this file.
Adj: 4:10pm

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 8:39am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan
(Motion before trial)

COURT addresses Motion to Introduce filed by State pending regarding 911 audio recording -- COURT has reviewed audio and transcript of same.
COURT questions if defense has any objections to the transcript being accurate -- Atty Jackan has not had opportunity to review; COURT recesses for Atty Jackan to do so.
8:52am BOTR -- Atty Jackan does not object to accuracy, but does object to its admission; Argument by State and by Atty Jackan on admission of recording (marked #6); COURT makes ruling and grants motion.

COURT questions parties re: jury notetaking - Parties defer to COURT; COURT will not allow notetaking.
COURT questions parties re: jury questions - Neither party requests and COURT will not allow.
COURT reminds parties of prior rulings in this case.
 State notes defendant provided with final offer -- Defendant has rejected offer; State requests written offer be sealed - COURT orders offer to be sealed and Contents may only be reviewed upon order of court
COURT recesses for beginning of trial - 9:02am

ADDRESS INFO for Terrance P Simmons
Current: 2909 Teal Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 09-24-2015)
Prior: 1610 N. 3rd Avenue #11, Wausau, WI 54401

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:23am
State appears by ADA M.Puerner; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Kat Jackan.
(Motions before trial)

COURT notes motions filed by each party -- Other Acts motion and MIL re: prior convictions, plus both parties MIL.

COURT addresses State's MIL>>
Defense notes motion re: 911 call; COURT does not have copy - State to provide copy of CD to COURT by the end of the day today, and transcript as soon as possible also.
COURT grants 1-6, 8, and 10
COURT will address 7 and 9 in other motions filed by parties.

COURT addresses Defense MIL>>
State agrees to granting of following -- 1, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12, 13, 14; COURT grants as agreed upon.
Atty Jackan withdraws 5 - COURT allows withdrawal.
COURT grants 3, COURT denies 11.
COURT will address 2 and 4 in other motions filed by parties.

COURT addresses State's Prior Convictions motion>>
Argument by parties on motion -- COURT makes rulings.

COURT addresses Other Acts Motion filed by State>>
Argument by parties on motion - COURT makes rulings.

COURT will make rulings on the 911 issue on morning of trial - parties to be in court by 8:30am.

Adj: 11:51am

Defense Motion to Deny Other Acts
-stj

Adj: 10:00 am

$1000.00 signature bond with first $200.00 in cash.    No contact with victim(s):  M.W. (non-waivable).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort (Wausau PD) to retrieve any personal belongings.  3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
